etymologies: Old English Messias: via late Latin and Greek from Hebrew māšīaḥ ‘anointed’

definitions: the promised deliverer of the Jewish nation prophesied in the Hebrew Bible.
shortDefinitions: promised deliverer of Jewish nation prophesied in Hebrew Bible

definitions: Jesus regarded by Christians as the Messiah of the Hebrew prophecies and the savior of humankind.
shortDefinitions: Jesus regarded by Christians as Messiah of Hebrew prophecies

definitions: a leader or savior of a particular group or cause

examples.text: he was regarded as a messiah by liberal and conservatives alike

shortDefinitions: leader regarded as saviour of particular country
